intro: Hieracium pannulatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Hieracium pannulatum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in many regions.
